cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north toward the north-central Gulf Coast with a turn to the northeast across the southeastern United States after landfall
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City, Louisiana (south-central LA coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from coastal Louisiana through Mississippi, Alabama, and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) with higher gusts possible at the port beginning late Friday night or early Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises of 2–3 ft above ground level possible along the lower Mississippi River and adjacent lakes (Lake Pontchartrain, Maurepas)
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with locally up to 12 inches, likely causing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes beginning Friday afternoon and continuing into Saturday
